intro: Noterophila pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf noterophila, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, dry fruits known as cypselae. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and delicate species.
